page.title: 02SUPERSTITIONS
page.content: SUPERSTITIONS Superstitions are found among sea-going folk all over the world and Eyemouth fishermen are no exception. They will not mention the names of certain creatures because to do so will bring bad luck, so a salmon is referred to as a "rid-yin", a pig as a "grumpy", a rabbit as a "bunny" etc. Some fishermen won't begin work on Friday nor will they go to sea if they meet anyone connected with the ministry or a lame person when on their way to the boat. If a fisherman or his family runs out of bread on a Sunday they will not borrow. They won't pay debts on a Sunday either.
